zambian.text: When you show the moon to a child, it sees only your finger.
A belching toad portends rain.
A fat woman warms even the coldest the night.
A man with a cross eye shall be put to the torch.
A monkey that pilfers from a widow's larder must not be admonished.
A riddle made by God has no solution.
A strong bull is seen by it's scars.
A tender bamboo cannot be eagerly desired for building.
A wild dog is best eaten when clubbed to death.
A woman without teeth shall be left to the lions.
An old poacher makes the best gamekeeper.
Beat your wife regularly; if you don't know why, she will.
Do not look at a visitor's face but at his stomach.
He who has a fever is not shown to the fire.
He who listened to the woman suffered famine at harvest time.
He who paddles two canoes, sinks.
I am because we are; we are because I am.
If you are ugly, learn how to dance.
If you have no teeth, do not break the clay cooking pot.
It is better to walk than curse the road.
It is inevitable that two thighs will rub against each other.
Jump over a log but not over your neighbor's word.
Lies have short legs.
Many are the eyes of the person whose spouse commits adultery.
One who enters a forest does not listen to the breaking of the twigs in the brush.
The king lives way up where the stench of the poor cannot reach him.
The shark who has eaten cannot swim with the shark that is hungry.
Things that are stolen will really never make you rich.
To get rid of anger, first weed out the bitter roots.
To give is to put.
Treat the days well and they will treat you well.
When you run alone, you run fast. When you run together, you run far.
When your luck deserts you, even cold food burns.
Where God cooks, there is no smoke.
You can trust your brother, your father, your mother, but never your wife.
You have to look after wealth, but knowledge looks after you.
You learn a lot about a man by his behavior when hungry.
Your feet will take you away from home, but your stomach will always bring you back.
There is no return, worse luck; for could I return, I would foresee what has come into the country.
They are happy, the free men that have their fathers.
We celebrated at the wax door, and all the time the honeycomb was empty within.
What is not bitter is good to eat.
What makes the drum pleasing is the song.
What nature gives us is not refused.
What one won't eat by itself, one will eat when mixed with other food.
When there is on a red-hot hoe, it is not grasped.
Where there is a friend, one does not have to call, he will come of his own accord.
Words in conversation are like beans, one breaks them off where they are ripe.
Dance, father, people's eyes don't eat, they just stare.
Days are many, what is one is life.
Days cannot be tied in a bundle.
Even if we eat, earth will eventually enter our mouth.
Even if you are cunning, you will not tie water up in a bale of grass.
Even if your bee-hive has no honey in it, you shouldn't break it up.
He was entrapped by the evening, it has cost him his marriage.
Hunger has no friend.
It is the grass that knows where the snake goes.
Just one by one white hairs have come, and thus have they grown.
Mother carry me, and I tomorrow will carry you.
Mr. Not-present was the brave man.
One doesn't follow a wild beast into its lair.
One mouth doesn't taste the beer.
People get to know one another when traveling.
Respect a little child, and let it respect you.
The insolence of shortness is to stretch itself big.
The judge also dies.
The owner of the skin is the one to tan it.
The tortoise stores its wisdom in his shell.
A bone does not bring itself, it is people that bring it.
A case is not to be decided from one mouth.
A child one does not instruct on return, one instructs him when going.
A kingdom's strength is in mutual honor.
A redeemer of people is a walker with people.
A stick one bends while it is still green.
Adjoining houses always burn.
Chieftanship is not infectious.
Cunning comes to an end, what remains is folly.
Cut of the sick part while it is still small.
Young man, countries practice witchcraft on one another.
Your friend, one doesn't stare at his forehead, one stares at his stomach.
Abuse of hospitality breaks the bridge.
Bad luck rots and in the end one rejoices.
A child is an axe; when it cuts you, you still pick it up and put it on your shoulder.
He who was busy with two things drowned.
One who eats a guinea fowl does not start to look like a guinea fowl.
The day you are unlucky, even the cold food burns.
The fire screened by the elders does not burn.
The fire which is screened by elders is not dangerous.
The little ant at its hole is full of courage.
The monkey who is alone does not amuse himself in front of many.
The person going home is not stopped by the dusk.
What makes the road long is laziness to go.
What women say is nonsense; but he who does not listen in is a fool.
When a monkey becomes old, it is fed by its young ones.
Leading a race does not mean that you will win it.
A bow which is stretched to the limit breaks.
Take good care of your neck; neck ornaments are not difficult to find.
The worlds of the elders do not lock all the doors; they leave the right door open.
You can learn a lot about someone by observing him when he is hungry.
A person who sells eggs should not start a fight in the market.
If you want to improve your memory, lend someone money.
If two wise men always agree, then there is no need for one of them.
The more feathers a chicken has, the bigger it looks.
